EVJ.Q: What is the global maximum heat value in the heatmap?
EVJ.A: The global maximum heat value is {0.96}.

EVJ.Q: What is the maximum heat value of label Development on the x-axis?
EVJ.A: The maximum heat value of Development on the x-axis is {0.96}.

EVJ.Q: What is the maximum heat value of label Land on the x-axis?

SC.Q: What is the average heat value for label Mortgages on the x-axis?
SC.A: The average heat value for Mortgages on the x-axis is {0.77}.

SC.Q: What is the average heat value for label Age on the y-axis?

SC.Q: What is the average heat value for label Rental on the x-axis?

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Development and Affordability or the cell corresponding to Rental and Price?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Development} and {Affordability} has a higher heat value.

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Residential and Affordability or the cell corresponding to REITs and Size?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {REITs} and {Size} has a higher heat value.

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Development and Affordability or the cell corresponding to Development and Inventory?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Development} and {Inventory} has a higher heat value.

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to REITs and Inventory or the cell corresponding to Rental and Inventory?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {REITs} and {Inventory} has a higher heat value.

MSR.Q: In the heatmap, what are the row and column labels for all cells whose heat values fall within the range of 0.22 to 0.31?
MSR.A: The cells are: {(Residential, Affordability), (Residential, Size), (Rental, Supply)}.
